intro: Gonolobus chloranthus, commonly known as the yellow bignay, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are small, globose capsules that contain several seeds. Gonolobus chloranthus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
